results.title: The Shoemaker and the elves
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: The story of th elves who slip into his shop and make shoes for the shoemaker is retold with animated puppets. This charming film, based on a Grimm fairytale, tells what happens when the shoemaker and his wife leave new clothes, food and sweets for the elves one night.
results.description: The story of th elves who slip into his shop and make shoes for the shoemaker is retold with animated puppets. This charming film, based on a Grimm fairytale, tells what happens when the shoemaker and his wife leave new clothes, food and sweets for the elves one night.

results.title: The Shock of the other
results.creator_credit: Richard Meech, Michael Grant and Biniman Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Millennium: tribal wisdom and the modern world”.
Host David Maybury-Lewis begins the series with a visit to his Xavante brother in Central Brazil where he explains the need to find a balance between cultural diversity and the desire to be more like one another. Journey with the Millennium team into the heart of the Amazon in Peru where they seek to unravel the mystery of the Mascho-Piro who remain hidden from the outside world. Through scenes of decimation of the tropical rainforests, interviews with threatened indigenous peoples, and the narrator’s reflections on the discovery of the Americas and other historical events, discover why so much is at stake when modern industrialism meets the tribal world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Meech, Michael Grant and Biniman Productions

results.title: The Shock of the New Series
results.creator_credit: Lorna Pegram, David Richardson, RM Productions, Time-Life Films and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: In this series, art critic and writer Robert Hughes outlines a social history of the development of the visual arts in the 20th century. In each episode, Hughes examines the forces which influenced the directions painting, architecture and photography took from the late 1800’s to the present.

results.title: The Shirley Temple collector's classic
results.brief_description: A collection of film excerpts and short films starring Hollywood’s favourite child actor, Shirley Temple. The four short films are interspersed with scenes from “The Little princess”. Quality is inconsistent and there is no narration or introduction.

results.title: The Shiralee
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, South Australian Film Corporation and George Ogilvie
results.brief_description: Macauley (Bryan Brown), a two-fisted street-fighter, takes to the roads of Australia’s outback with his young daughter, his ‘shiralee’, his burden. They walk from town to town looking for work. When none is to be found Macauley wants to get rid of his shiralee but he is too proud to return her to his unfaithful wife. So begins the story of the growing love between a father and his daughter. Based on the novel by D’Arcy Niland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Moir, South Australian Film Corporation and George Ogilvie

results.title: The Shining
results.creator_credit: Producer Circle Company and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: In Stanley Kubrick’s chilling adaptation of a Stephen King horror novel, Jack Torrance, a struggling writer, accepts a job as caretaker of the Overlook Hotel, a luxurious but remote resort with a macabre history of violence. The hotel is closed for the winter, and Jack, his wife, Wendy, and son, Danny, will be the only residents for several snowy months. Jack hopes that the solitude will give him a chance to focus on his writing, but he soon spirals helplessly towards madness and murder as the hotel’s power plays upon his weaknesses. Cast includes: Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Scatman Crothers and Danny Lloyd.

results.title: The Shillingbury blowers
results.creator_credit: Greg Smith, Inner Circle Films and Val Guest
results.brief_description: A tale about a quaint English village and its community Brass Band known as the Shillingbury Blowers led by its much loved conductor, Old Saltie (Trevor Howard). Tells of how this rather old-fashioned and conventional village is turned on its head when young pop musician Peter Higgins (Robin Nedwell) and his wife Sally (Diane Keen) move into town. Cast includes Jack Douglas, John Le Mesurier, Patrick Newell, Diane King. Music composed and conducted by Ed Welch.

results.title: The Shield
results.creator_credit: National Society for the Prevention of Blindness and Leo Trachtenberg
results.brief_description: Presents statements from industrial employees whose eyesight was saved by wearing eye protection, followed by statements from a man who was blinded in an industrial accident. Demoonstrates the typical use of eye protection - shileds, special glasses and shades.

results.title: The Sherpas of Everest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
The story of Sherpa, Sirdar Ang Tsering, one of the few men ever to stand atop the summit of Everest. He is shown making a pilgrimage from his home village of Namche Bazar to the mountain which has made him famous.
